data.title: NOVA EXPRESS by Burroughs, William S.: (1964) First edition.
data.meta_description: First edition. - Hardcover - Grove Press, Inc, New York - 1964 - Dust Jacket Included - First printing of the third novel in Burroughs's Nova Trilogy. Praised by mainstream literary and genre critics alike, NOVA EXPRESS was nominated for a 1965 Nebula Award by the Science Fiction Writers of America, NOVA EXPRESS follows THE SOFT MACHINE and THE TICKET THAT EXPLODED in the 'Cut-up Trilogy', written using the experimental cut-up technique originated by Burroughs, Brion Gysin, and Ian Sommerville; Burroughs credits Sommerville for collaboration on the section titled "This Horrible Case." 8'' x 5.5''. Original bright orange cloth. In original unclipped ($5.00) dust jacket. 187, [1] pages. Light foxing to jacket, with minor scuffing to spine ends. Faint toning to endpapers; occasional light foxing to interior pages. Near fine in very good plus jacket. - NOVA EXPRESS
data.text:
About this Item

First printing of the third novel in Burroughs's Nova Trilogy. Praised by mainstream literary and genre critics alike, NOVA EXPRESS was nominated for a 1965 Nebula Award by the Science Fiction Writers of America, NOVA EXPRESS follows THE SOFT MACHINE and THE TICKET THAT EXPLODED in the 'Cut-up Trilogy', written using the experimental cut-up technique originated by Burroughs, Brion Gysin, and Ian Sommerville; Burroughs credits Sommerville for collaboration on the section titled "This Horrible Case." 8'' x 5.5''. Original bright orange cloth. In original unclipped ($5.00) dust jacket. 187, [1] pages. Light foxing to jacket, with minor scuffing to spine ends. Faint toning to endpapers; occasional light foxing to interior pages. Near fine in very good plus jacket. Seller Inventory # 40660

Contact seller

Report this item

Brian Cassidy Bookseller at Type Punch Matrix is the counterculture department of Type Punch Matrix, a rare book firm co-founded in 2019 by longtime booksellers Brian Cassidy and Rebecca Romney. BCB @ TPM specialized broadly in the 20th avant garde and countercultural movements ? including the beats, the mimeo revolution, artists' books, pulps, music,poetry and small press, modern and contemporary art and photography, as well as interesting and important archival and vernacular materials. We are proud members of: Antiquarian Booksellers' Association of America (ABAA), International League of Antiquarian Booksellers (ILAB), and the International Online Booksellers Association (IOBA).

Visit Seller's Storefront

Association Member Members of these associations are committed to maintaining the highest standards. They vouch for the authenticity of all items offered for sale. They provide expert and detailed descriptions, disclose all significant defects and/or restorations, provide clear and accurate pricing, and operate with fairness and honesty during the purchase experience.

Seller's business information

Type Punch Matrix Inc.

8115 Fenton St., Suite 206, Silver Spring, MD, 20910, U.S.A.

Terms of Sale:

MD residents please add 6% sales tax. Payment by check (wait to clear) or money order. Please make these

out to "Brian Cassidy." We also accept credit cards, Paypal (books@briancassidy.net), or ABE checkout.

Returns accepted for any reason up to thirty (30) days from date of order. However, unless not as

described, postage to be paid by buyer. Libraries, institutions, and dealers known to me may be invoiced.

Reciprocal trade courtesies extended.

Shipping Terms:

Orders usually ship within 2 business days. All books are shipped with delivery confirmation and are properly packaged to ensure their safe arrival in condition sent. If your book order is heavy or oversized, we may contact you to let you know extra shipping is required.
